Package game

Class Ship

  • java.lang.Object
    • javafx.scene.Node
      • javafx.scene.shape.Shape
        • javafx.scene.shape.Rectangle
          • game.Ship
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    javafx.css.Styleable, javafx.event.EventTarget
    public class Ship
extends javafx.scene.shape.Rectangle

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      private boolean alive
      True if the ship has not been destroyed
      private int[] basePosition
      First element is the x-position in of the upper left corner of the Ship in the Board's grid Second element is the y-position in of the upper left corner of the Ship in the Board's grid
      private int health
      The amount of tiles the Ship has which have not been attacked
      private int heightTiles
      Amount of tiles the Ship has in its height, which is along the y-axis if the ship's rotation is 0 (what you would normally call the width of a Ship).
      private boolean offsetAdded
      True if the latest position-offset has been added to the Ship's position
      private Board parentBoard
      The parent Board of the Ship
      private int positionOffsetX
      A Ship's latest x-position-offset (in amount of tiles) to make the ship be displayed at the right position in the Board's grid when it is rotated.
      private int positionOffsetY
      A Ship's latest y-position-offset (in amount of tiles) to make the ship be displayed at the right position in the Board's grid when it is rotated.
      private int rotation
      The current rotation of the Ship in degrees
      private double startDragX
      The x-position of the latest mouse press.
      private double startDragY
      The y-position of the latest mouse press.
      private int tilesX
      How many tiles the Ship occupies in the x-direction in its current rotation
      private int tilesY
      How many tiles the Ship occupies in the y-direction in its current rotation
      private int totalPositionOffsetX
      A Ship's total x-position-offset (in amount of tiles) to make the ship be displayed at the right position in the Board's grid when it is rotated.
      private int totalPositionOffsetY
      A Ship's total y-position-offset (in amount of tiles) to make the ship be displayed at the right position in the Board's grid when it is rotated.
      private int widthTiles
      Amount of tiles the Ship has in its width, which is along the x-axis if the ship's rotation is 0 (what you would normally call the length of a Ship).

      • Fields inherited from class javafx.scene.Node

        BASELINE_OFFSET_SAME_AS_HEIGHT

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      Ship​(boolean visible, int tileX, int tileY, int width, int height, int rotation, Board parentBoard)
      Initializes a ship, loads its image and updates its position, size, rotation and visibility.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      private void addOffset()
      Adds the current rotations position offset to the Ship's position to make it appear in the right place Also adds the position offset of the current rotation to the totalPositionOffset variables
      int[] getBasePosition()
      Gets the base position of the Ship, which is the upper left corner.
      int getHeightTiles()
      Get the amount of tiles the Ship has in its height, which is along the y-axis if the ship's rotation is 0 (what you would normally call the width of a Ship).
      int getRotation()
      Gets the rotation of the ship in degrees
      int getRotationCenterX()
      Gets the x-position of the Ship's rotation point in the grid
      int getRotationCenterY()
      Gets the y-position of the Ship's rotation point in the grid
      int getTilesX()
      Gets how many tiles the Ship occupies in the x-direction in its current rotation
      int getTilesY()
      Gets how many tiles the Ship occupies in the y-direction in its current rotation
      int getTileX()
      Gets the x-position of the upper left corner of the Ship in the grid
      int getTileY()
      Gets the y-position of the upper left corner of the Ship in the grid
      int getWidthTiles()
      Get the amount of tiles the Ship has in its width, which is along the x-axis if the ship's rotation is 0 (what you would normally call the length of a Ship).
      boolean isAlive()
      Gets the status of the "alive" boolean class variable.
      void loadImage()
      Automatically loads the image file which fits the size of the ship.
      int reduceHealth()
      Reduces the health of the ship by 1
      private void rotateRight()
      Rotates the ship 90 degrees clockwise and updates the Ship's position-offset to make the ship be displayed at the right position in the Board's grid.
      private void rotateRight​(int times)
      Rotates the Ship 90 degrees clockwise a set amount of times (the parameter).
      void setTilePos​(int x, int y)
      Used to snap the Ship-Rectangle to tile (x,y) in the parent Board
      private void updateBasePosition()
      Updates the basePosition class variable so that it stores the x and y position of the Ship's upper left corner in the grid.
      private void updatePosition()
      Adds the saved offset from the Ship's rotation to make calculation correct.
      private void updateSize()
      Updates the size of the ship to be displayed with the correct width and height in the Board's grid

    • Field Detail

      • basePosition

        private int[] basePosition
        First element is the x-position in of the upper left corner of the Ship in the Board's grid Second element is the y-position in of the upper left corner of the Ship in the Board's grid

      • widthTiles

        private int widthTiles
        Amount of tiles the Ship has in its width, which is along the x-axis if the ship's rotation is 0 (what you would normally call the length of a Ship).

      • heightTiles

        private int heightTiles
        Amount of tiles the Ship has in its height, which is along the y-axis if the ship's rotation is 0 (what you would normally call the width of a Ship).

      • tilesX

        private int tilesX
        How many tiles the Ship occupies in the x-direction in its current rotation

      • tilesY

        private int tilesY
        How many tiles the Ship occupies in the y-direction in its current rotation

      • positionOffsetX

        private int positionOffsetX
        A Ship's latest x-position-offset (in amount of tiles) to make the ship be displayed at the right position in the Board's grid when it is rotated.

      • positionOffsetY

        private int positionOffsetY
        A Ship's latest y-position-offset (in amount of tiles) to make the ship be displayed at the right position in the Board's grid when it is rotated.

      • totalPositionOffsetX

        private int totalPositionOffsetX
        A Ship's total x-position-offset (in amount of tiles) to make the ship be displayed at the right position in the Board's grid when it is rotated.

      • totalPositionOffsetY

        private int totalPositionOffsetY
        A Ship's total y-position-offset (in amount of tiles) to make the ship be displayed at the right position in the Board's grid when it is rotated.

      • offsetAdded

        private boolean offsetAdded
        True if the latest position-offset has been added to the Ship's position

      • rotation

        private int rotation
        The current rotation of the Ship in degrees

      • parentBoard

        private final Board parentBoard
        The parent Board of the Ship

      • startDragX

        private double startDragX
        The x-position of the latest mouse press. Used to make dragging Ships possible.

      • startDragY

        private double startDragY
        The y-position of the latest mouse press. Used to make dragging Ships possible.

      • health

        private int health
        The amount of tiles the Ship has which have not been attacked

      • alive

        private boolean alive
        True if the ship has not been destroyed

    • Constructor Detail

      • Ship

        public Ship​(boolean visible,
            int tileX,
            int tileY,
            int width,
            int height,
            int rotation,
            Board parentBoard)
        Initializes a ship, loads its image and updates its position, size, rotation and visibility. Creates some event listeners for dragging and rotation functionality.
        Parameters:
        visible - if the ship is visible
        tileX - x-position in the board-grid
        tileY - y-position in the board-grid
        width - width in amount of tiles
        height - height in amount of tiles
        rotation - rotation of the ship in degrees
        parentBoard - the board that contains the ship

    • Method Detail

      • updatePosition

        private void updatePosition()
        Adds the saved offset from the Ship's rotation to make calculation correct. Checks if the Ship is inside the parent board, and fixes it if not. Updates the displayed position of the Ship to the its actual position.

      • addOffset

        private void addOffset()
        Adds the current rotations position offset to the Ship's position to make it appear in the right place Also adds the position offset of the current rotation to the totalPositionOffset variables

      • setTilePos

        public void setTilePos​(int x,
                       int y)
        Used to snap the Ship-Rectangle to tile (x,y) in the parent Board
        Parameters:
        x - Tile number x from left to right, 0 to (max number of tiles - 1 - width in tiles)
        y - Tile number y from left to right, 0 to (max number of tiles - 1 - height in tiles)

      • getRotationCenterX

        public int getRotationCenterX()
        Gets the x-position of the Ship's rotation point in the grid
        Returns:
        the x-position of the Ship's rotation point in the grid

      • getRotationCenterY

        public int getRotationCenterY()
        Gets the y-position of the Ship's rotation point in the grid
        Returns:
        the y-position of the Ship's rotation point in the grid

      • getTileX

        public int getTileX()
        Gets the x-position of the upper left corner of the Ship in the grid
        Returns:
        the x-position of the upper left corner of the Ship in the grid

      • getTileY

        public int getTileY()
        Gets the y-position of the upper left corner of the Ship in the grid
        Returns:
        the y-position of the upper left corner of the Ship in the grid

      • getRotation

        public int getRotation()
        Gets the rotation of the ship in degrees
        Returns:
        the rotation of the ship in degrees

      • reduceHealth

        public int reduceHealth()
        Reduces the health of the ship by 1
        Returns:
        the remaining health

      • loadImage

        public void loadImage()
        Automatically loads the image file which fits the size of the ship. If that image doesn't exist, the method will load a random color instead.

      • isAlive

        public boolean isAlive()
        Gets the status of the "alive" boolean class variable. Alive=false means the ship is completely destroyed.
        Returns:
        status of boolean class variable "alive"

      • rotateRight

        private void rotateRight​(int times)
        Rotates the Ship 90 degrees clockwise a set amount of times (the parameter).
        Parameters:
        times - how many times the ship should rotate 90 degrees clockwise

      • rotateRight

        private void rotateRight()
        Rotates the ship 90 degrees clockwise and updates the Ship's position-offset to make the ship be displayed at the right position in the Board's grid.

      • updateSize

        private void updateSize()
        Updates the size of the ship to be displayed with the correct width and height in the Board's grid

      • updateBasePosition

        private void updateBasePosition()
        Updates the basePosition class variable so that it stores the x and y position of the Ship's upper left corner in the grid.

      • getBasePosition

        public int[] getBasePosition()
        Gets the base position of the Ship, which is the upper left corner.
        Returns:
        an array with a length of 2, first element is x, second element is y. This is the position of the upper left corner of the Ship in the Board's grid.

      • getWidthTiles

        public int getWidthTiles()
        Get the amount of tiles the Ship has in its width, which is along the x-axis if the ship's rotation is 0 (what you would normally call the length of a Ship).
        Returns:
        how wide the ship (rectangle) is, in tiles

      • getHeightTiles

        public int getHeightTiles()
        Get the amount of tiles the Ship has in its height, which is along the y-axis if the ship's rotation is 0 (what you would normally call the width of a Ship).
        Returns:
        how tall the ship (rectangle) is, in tiles

      • getTilesX

        public int getTilesX()
        Gets how many tiles the Ship occupies in the x-direction in its current rotation
        Returns:
        how many tiles the Ship occupies in the x-direction in its current rotation

      • getTilesY

        public int getTilesY()
        Gets how many tiles the Ship occupies in the y-direction in its current rotation
        Returns:
        how many tiles the Ship occupies in the y-direction in its current rotation
